when_to_say: Used to express gratitude.
example: Gracias por tu ayuda - Thank you for your help.

when_to_say: Used as a greeting.
example: ¡Hola, ¿cómo estás? - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to say goodbye.
example: Adiós, nos vemos mañana - Goodbye, see you tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used when making a request.
example: ¿Me pasas el libro, por favor? - Can you pass me the book, please?

when_to_say: Used to apologize.
example: Perdón, no te vi - Sorry, I didn’t see you.

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: ¡Buenos días! ¿Cómo amaneciste? - Good morning! How did you wake up?

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the afternoon.
example: Buenas tardes, ¿cómo estás? - Good afternoon, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the evening or to say goodnight.
example: Buenas noches, que descanses - Good night, rest well.

when_to_say: Used to express agreement.
example: ¿Te gustaría venir? Sí, me encantaría. - Would you like to come? Yes, I’d love to.

when_to_say: Used to express disagreement.
example: ¿Quieres más comida? No, gracias. - Do you want more food? No, thank you.

when_to_say: Used to ask about someone's well-being.
example: ¿Cómo estás hoy? - How are you today?

when_to_say: Used to describe something as good or someone as well.
example: Estoy bien, gracias - I’m good, thank you.

when_to_say: Used to describe something as bad or someone as unwell.
example: No me siento bien, estoy mal - I don’t feel well, I’m bad.

when_to_say: Used to express that things are neither good nor bad.
example: ¿Cómo estás? Así así - How are you? So-so.

when_to_say: Used to ask the same question in return.
example: Estoy bien, gracias. ¿Y tú? - I’m good, thank you. And you?

when_to_say: Used to refer to oneself.
example: Yo soy estudiante - I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to refer informally to someone.
example: Tú eres mi amigo - You are my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a male subject.
example: Él es mi hermano - He is my brother.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a female subject.
example: Ella es mi amiga - She is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a group that includes yourself.
example: Nosotros vamos al cine - We are going to the cinema.

when_to_say: Used to refer to oneself.
example: Yo soy estudiante - I am a student.

when_to_say: Used to refer informally to someone.
example: Tú eres mi amigo - You are my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a male subject.
example: Él es mi hermano - He is my brother.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a female subject.
example: Ella es mi amiga - She is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a group that includes yourself.
example: Nosotros vamos al cine - We are going to the cinema.

when_to_say: Used when talking about eating.
example: Me gusta comer pizza - I like to eat pizza.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking.
example: Quiero beber agua - I want to drink water.

when_to_say: Used when talking about walking.
example: Me gusta caminar en el parque - I like to walk in the park.

when_to_say: Used when talking about running.
example: Él corre todos los días - He runs every day.

when_to_say: Used when talking about reading.
example: Ella lee libros en su tiempo libre - She reads books in her free time.

when_to_say: Used when talking about writing.
example: Yo escribo cartas a mis amigos - I write letters to my friends.

when_to_say: Used when talking about speaking.
example: Nosotros hablamos español - We speak Spanish.

when_to_say: Used when talking about listening.
example: Ella escucha música - She listens to music.

when_to_say: Used when talking about seeing.
example: Veo una película esta noche - I watch a movie tonight.

when_to_say: Used when talking about living.
example: Yo vivo en Madrid - I live in Madrid.

when_to_say: Used when talking about working.
example: Mi padre trabaja en una oficina - My father works in an office.

when_to_say: Used when talking about studying.
example: Ellos estudian para el examen - They study for the exam.

when_to_say: Used when talking about singing.
example: Me gusta cantar canciones - I like to sing songs.

when_to_say: Used to refer to work or a job.
example: Tengo mucho trabajo - I have a lot of work.

when_to_say: Used when referring to school.
example: La escuela empieza a las 8 - School starts at 8.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a book.
example: Estoy leyendo un libro interesante - I am reading an interesting book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a movie.
example: Vamos a ver una película esta noche - We are going to watch a movie tonight.

when_to_say: Used when talking about playing.
example: Los niños juegan al fútbol - The children play soccer.

when_to_say: Used when talking about living.
example: Vivo en un apartamento - I live in an apartment.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a car.
example: Tengo un coche rojo - I have a red car.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a table.
example: La mesa está en el comedor - The table is in the dining room.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a chair.
example: Necesito una silla para sentarme - I need a chair to sit on.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a window.
example: La ventana está abierta - The window is open.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a door.
example: La puerta está cerrada - The door is closed.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a floor.
example: El piso está limpio - The floor is clean.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a ceiling.
example: El techo está muy alto - The ceiling is very high.

when_to_say: Used when referring to lunch.
example: Voy a preparar el almuerzo - I am going to prepare lunch.

when_to_say: Used when referring to breakfast.
example: Desayuno cereal todas las mañanas - I eat cereal for breakfast every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to dinner.
example: La cena está lista - The dinner is ready.

when_to_say: Used when referring to fruit.
example: Me encanta comer fruta - I love eating fruit.

when_to_say: Used when referring to vegetables.
example: Ella cocina muchas verduras - She cooks a lot of vegetables.

when_to_say: Used when referring to meat.
example: Me gusta la carne de res - I like beef.

when_to_say: Used when referring to bread.
example: Compro pan en la panadería - I buy bread at the bakery.

when_to_say: Used when referring to water.
example: Necesito agua - I need water.

when_to_say: Used when referring to milk.
example: Bebo leche todas las mañanas - I drink milk every morning.

when_to_say: Used when referring to tea.
example: Tomamos té en la tarde - We drink tea in the afternoon.

when_to_say: Used when referring to coffee.
example: Me gusta el café con leche - I like coffee with milk.

when_to_say: Used when referring to sugar.
example: ¿Cuánto azúcar quieres en tu té? - How much sugar do you want in your tea?

when_to_say: Used when referring to salt.
example: Añade sal a la sopa - Add salt to the soup.

when_to_say: Used when referring to pepper.
example: Le pongo pimienta a la ensalada - I put pepper on the salad.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a book.
example: Estoy leyendo un libro - I am reading a book.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a notebook.
example: Escribe en tu cuaderno - Write in your notebook.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a pen.
example: Tengo una pluma roja - I have a red pen.

when_to_say: Used when referring to paper.
example: Dame un poco de papel - Give me some paper.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a folder.
example: Puse los papeles en la carpeta - I put the papers in the folder.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a desk.
example: El escritorio está desordenado - The desk is messy.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a blackboard.
example: Escribí en la pizarra - I wrote on the blackboard.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a classroom.
example: La clase está en el aula 12 - The class is in room 12.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a male teacher.
example: El profesor explica la lección - The teacher explains the lesson.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a female teacher.
example: La profesora está enseñando - The teacher is teaching.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a spoon.
example: Necesito una cuchara para la sopa - I need a spoon for the soup.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a fork.
example: Usa el tenedor para comer - Use the fork to eat.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a knife.
example: El cuchillo está en la mesa - The knife is on the table.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a plate.
example: Pon el plato en la mesa - Put the plate on the table.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a glass.
example: El vaso está vacío - The glass is empty.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a cup.
example: Bebo café en la taza - I drink coffee from the cup.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a napkin.
example: Pásame una servilleta, por favor - Pass me a napkin, please.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a dessert fork.
example: Usa el tenedor de postre para el pastel - Use the dessert fork for the cake.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a ladle.
example: El cucharón está en la olla - The ladle is in the pot.

when_to_say: Used when referring to the pan used for making paella.
example: La paellera es grande - The paella pan

when_to_say: Used to describe someone or something that is happy.
example: Estoy feliz hoy - I am happy today.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone or something that is sad.
example: Ella está triste - She is sad.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is angry.
example: Mi hermano está enojado - My brother is angry.

when_to_say: Used when you are feeling tired.
example: Estoy cansado después de trabajar - I am tired after working.

when_to_say: Used when you are feeling bored.
example: Estoy aburrido en casa - I am bored at home.

when_to_say: Used when you are excited about something.
example: Estoy emocionado por el viaje - I am excited for the trip.

when_to_say: Used when you are nervous.
example: Estoy nervioso antes del examen - I am nervous before the exam.

when_to_say: Used when you are proud of something.
example: Estoy orgulloso de ti - I am proud of you.

when_to_say: Used when you are worried about something.
example: Estoy preocupado por el examen - I am worried about the exam.

when_to_say: Used when someone is calm or peaceful.
example: Estoy tranquilo después de meditar - I am calm after meditating.

when_to_say: Used when you are busy.
example: Estoy ocupado trabajando - I am busy working.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone who is cheerful.
example: Ella es muy alegre - She is very cheerful.

when_to_say: Used when you are sick or not feeling well.
example: Estoy enfermo y no puedo salir - I am sick and cannot go out.

when_to_say: Used when referring to wealth or something delicious.
example: Este pastel está rico - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used when someone feels lonely.
example: Me siento solitario en casa - I feel lonely at home.

when_to_say: Used when someone feels anxious.
example: Estoy ansioso por saber los resultados - I am anxious to know the results.

when_to_say: Used when someone is surprised.
example: Estoy sorprendido por el regalo - I am surprised by the gift.

when_to_say: Used when someone is desperate or hopeless.
example: Estoy desesperado por encontrar una solución - I am desperate to find a solution.

when_to_say: Used when you are fascinated or amazed.
example: Estoy fascinado con el arte - I am fascinated by the art.

when_to_say: Used when someone is going somewhere.
example: Voy al mercado - I am going to the market.

when_to_say: Used when someone is seeing or watching something.
example: Veo una película - I am watching a movie.

when_to_say: Used when someone is doing or making something.
example: Hago ejercicio todos los días - I do exercise every day.

when_to_say: Used when eating something.
example: Comemos pizza en la noche - We eat pizza at night.

when_to_say: Used when drinking something.
example: Bebo agua todos los días - I drink water every day.

when_to_say: Used when writing something.
example: Escribo una carta - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when reading something.
example: Leo libros en mi tiempo libre - I read books in my free time.

when_to_say: Used when talking about living in a place.
example: Vivo en Madrid - I live in Madrid.

when_to_say: Used when talking about working.
example: Trabajo en una oficina - I work in an office.

when_to_say: Used when leaving or going out.
example: Salgo de la casa a las ocho - I leave the house at eight.

when_to_say: Used when putting something somewhere.
example: Pongo las llaves en la mesa - I put the keys on the table.

when_to_say: Used when making a decision.
example: Decido ir al cine - I decide to go to the movies.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a verb in grammar.
example: El verbo 'comer' es regular - The verb 'comer' is regular.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a subject or theme.
example: El tema de la clase es la gramática - The topic of the class is grammar.

when_to_say: Used when changing something.
example: Voy a cambiar la ropa - I am going to change the clothes.

when_to_say: Used when starting or beginning something.
example: Empiezo el trabajo mañana - I begin the work tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used when finishing something.
example: Termino mi tarea después de cenar - I finish my homework after dinner.

when_to_say: Used when finding something.
example: Encontré mis llaves en el bolso - I found my keys in the bag.

when_to_say: Used when preparing something.
example: Estoy preparando la comida - I am preparing the food.

when_to_say: Used when using something.
example: Uso mi teléfono todo el día - I use my phone all day.
